intro: Brochosiphon australis, commonly known as the Australian brochosiphon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and sandy habitats. Brochosiphon australis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by Indigenous Australians for various purposes.
